snippet: Delegations from five countries were denied permission to use Israeli border crossings because their governments do not recognize the state of Israel, a decision that angered the Palestinians.
abstract: Israel bars the delegations of five countries from attending a diplomatic conference in Ramallah, in the West Bank, because their governments do not recognize the state of Israel; move upends plans by Palestinian Pres Mahmoud Abbas to announce his intention to renew Palestinians’ bid for enhanced status in the United Nations.

byline.contributor: Khaled Abu Aker contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank, and Fares Akram from Gaza City.

lead_paragraph: Delegations from five countries were denied permission to use Israeli border crossings because their governments do not recognize the state of Israel, a decision that angered the Palestinians.

headline.seo: Israel Bars Foreign Envoys From West Bank Meeting
headline.main: Israel Bars Foreign Envoys From West Bank Meeting
headline.print_headline: West Bank Talks Canceled After Israel Bars Envoys
